programme.title: One Small Step
programme.desc: Oftentimes climate change and pollution can seem like unfathomably difficult problems to solve. Out host’s goal is to calm those fears by inviting the audience along with her as she strives to learn how to take action against the problems plaguing our planet. In One Small Step we explore how recycling works, where our waste goes, and how we can fix the planet through our actions as individuals. Hosted by Lucy Biggers, a growing influencer in the sustainability space.

programme.title: The End

programme.title: Cloud Cities of Venus
programme.desc: The surface air of Venus is 95% carbon dioxide, and has an atmospheric pressure equivalent to being 900 meters deep in the ocean. These conditions are of course, unlivable for humans. However the key to settling on the second planet from the Sun might not lie on its surface, but hang in its clouds.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "A Deadly Deal" - Reed Baley is found unconscious the morning after his bachelor party. Now, it's up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame or if there was another cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Evil Intent" - Authorities respond to a fire, only to find Carolyn Casey's body at the center of the blaze. With little evidence and no witnesses, Dr. G must find the cause of death to catch her killer.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Disturbing Behavior" - Leo Guzman falls off a ladder while painting a house. At first, his death seems to be an open-and-shut case but, as the autopsy unfolds, Dr. G believes there may be more to this case.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Wounded" - A teen is eating breakfast when his dad starts stabbing himself. As the investigation unfolds, police begin to doubt the story. Dr. G must determine if this was a suicide or a murder.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Hidden Killers" - When Marie Allen visits her sister, she makes a gruesome discovery: the 49-year-old is dead on the couch. Now, it's up to Dr. G to figure out if this was an accident or something sinister.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Playing With Fire" - Dr. Farley discusses the bizarre case of a pregnant mother who suddenly dies. As the autopsy unfolds, Dr. Farley uncovers information that could have saved her and her unborn child's life.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Bite" - Roy Cambells is found dead and covered with scratches, his aggressive 80lb dog by his side. Dr. G wonders if the dog could have been responsible for the man's death.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Deadly Circumstances" - Dario Romano is found dead by his son at the bottom of the attic ladder. What happened to this 45-year-old? With Dr. G's guidance, Dr. Stephany must solve the mystery.

programme.title: Dr. G Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Fatal Encounters" - Keith Douglas is met with a barrage of bullets as he opens his door. The police are looking to Dr. G for hard evidence to link certain suspects to the murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Redemption" - An 82-year-old woman appears to have committed suicide by overdosing on painkillers, but Dr. G finds evidence that suggests that she may have died of a heart attack.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A married couple decided to escape the cold of winter with a mini-vacation in Key West. The wife went missing, and police searched every square inch of the island, they found nothing but a pair of sandals which might have belonged to her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, when the wife of a serviceman was brutally murdered in the Philippines, investigators had to reassemble a 5-1/4 inch computer disk which had been cut to pieces with pinking shears in order to find the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bombings are difficult to solve, because the perpetrator isn't usually at the scene, and the evidence goes up in smoke. In this case pieces of plastic the size of grains of sand hold the key to a man's murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The wife of an Air Force officer was found dead in her bed with a plastic laundry bag near her face. Further investigation proved that the scene had been staged. Her death wasn't an accident, it was cold-blooded murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a fire destroyed most of a home and a young boy went missing, police organized the largest search in the history of their small town. First the boy's backpack was discovered five miles from home, and then his body was found 50 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The decomposed body of a young woman was discovered in a Bakersfield irrigation canal. If there was trace evidence, it had been washed away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A behavioral profile caused the Baton Rouge Police Department to search for the wrong man. They might not have made an arrest had it not been for a DNA picture of the suspect painted by a molecular biologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An obstetrician returned home from the hospital and found his wife on the bathroom floor. She was covered with blood and not breathing. He tried unsuccessfully to revive her, staining his clothes with her blood in the process, and then he called 911.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When police recovered the submerged car of a man reported missing, they expected to find his body - but it wasn't there. The investigation which followed would uncover an obsession turned deadly, and the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Emergency dispatch received a call from a man who said his girlfriend shot and killed herself. The autopsy revealed that the gunshot wound was not self-inflicted and the evidence on her body would give police a golden opportunity to catch her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Native American woman was brutally killed in the desert of New Mexico, and the crime scene was rich in forensic evidence: tire tracks, shoe impressions and even the murder weapons.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An employee of a dry cleaner was raped and murdered in the store. Police turned to forensic science for the answers they needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college student was found dead, and the evidence suggested he knew his killer. Three hairs and some microscopic cells helped police to unravel a web of lies, and find the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teenager went missing after an evening of horseback riding. Her body was found a month later, three miles from her home. The killer unknowingly left trace evidence behind - tiny but unmistakable clues which pointed to him and him alone.

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail Offseason S14:E12 "Breaking Down the Hunt, Josh’s Best Lesson"
programme.desc: On this week's episode we start off by joining multiple members of the team as they fill their turkey tags. Then we join Bill, who breaks down the hunt for the massive buck he harvested back in 2016 that he called "Lefty." Next we join Josh Sparks who discusses the best lesson he's learned over his last 4 years of hunting.

programme.title: Midwest Whitetail Offseason S14:E13 "Big Bucks on Permission, Poor Man Plot Success"
programme.desc: On this week's episode, we start off with Bill who shows how successful one of the Poor Man Plots he put in last season is doing. He covers the steps he took to make the plot and offers tips so you can make one of your own. Then we join Josh Sparks who lays out the plans for a food plot that he and Kaleb Greiner are creating using this poor man style. Finally, we join Jared Mills on a throwback hunt as he covers some of the biggest challenges that come with hunting big deer on permission. Jared also offers creative advice on how to gain permission for hunting.

programme.title: "On Deck" With Captain Cory McGuire
programme.desc: For someone like Capt. Cory who's out on the water most days of the year, it's easy to notice the little changes that show the stress on an ecosystem. Whether that's subtle movements of fish from lingering red tide blooms or large-scale impacts from high-volume Lak Okeechobee discharges, he sees it all, and he's ready for things to change. "I wish we would get to a point where we really put our foot down and do something about it before it's too late." Watch this episode to learn more about what's going on and to see why Capt. Cory is so passionate about fighting to protect the places he loves. Visit https://captainsforcleanwater.org to join the fight.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Nazareth - American by Choice
programme.desc: Award Winning Comedian Nazareth, has been seen by over 40 Million people around the world through live concerts, TV and Radio broadcasts. His list of TV appearances include: Comedy Central, ABC Family, NBC, CBS, and TBN.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Brian Bates - Uber Important
programme.desc: Turning to comedy after twenty years in corporate America, Brian Bates jokes about ubering his hecklers home, meeting women while hiking, and people who dont believe in God but do believe in wrestling.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Mark Poolos - One Wife, Two Daughters, and Zero Influence
programme.desc: Mark stands 6'7" weighs in at 350 technically a giant however he is very weak and a wimp. In his routines, he weaves the story of his life as a bumbling jolly giant in his fast engaging storytelling style. He has been compared to Louie Anderson. Mark is a true road dog, performing in 40 states and all across Canada. Mark's ultimate dream is to do a film that people actually will have seen.

programme.title: Jason Love - Jokes On Me
programme.desc: One of today's busiest comics, Jason Love has appeared on HBO, Comedy Central, America's Got Talent, and over 20 national broadcasts.Jason works clean and incorporates music, making him a favorite for companies like Google, Chevron, Farmers, and Costco.Says L.A. Weekly: "Jason Love is comedy that brings people together."From the Hollywood Improv to Carolines on Broadway, Jasons audience continues to grow. He has performed overseas for the troops and on the seas for cruise lines. Jason was a finalist at the Cabo Comedy Festival and at the World Series of Comedy in Vegas.Jasons non-profit, Love &amp Laughter, brings free shows to cancer support communities and others in need. His podcast is produced by Levity Entertainment. He is represented by Don Casino Productions.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Eric O Shea - Life: It's Not Your Fault
programme.desc: Eric O'Shea has been active in the comedy business for 25 years. He has performed in L.A. with Betty White at the Creative Emmy Awards and has appeared on America's Got Talent TV Show. Every year since 1997, Eric has performed an average of 70 shows a year, and has received 7 nominations as the “National College Comedian of the Year”

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Shayne Smith - Prison for Wizards
programme.desc: Former Gang Member, current comedian, future famous comedian. Shayne Smith is the runner up in the Wiseguys’ 2015 Funniest Person In Utah competition, winner of the 2015 Salt City Comedy Superstar contest and most recently voted best Alternative Comedian of 2016 by City Weekly.

programme.title: Moody Molavi - Remove Before Flight
programme.desc: The christian comic is married to his high school sweetheart, who later became his stepsister through the marriage of their parents to each other. That’s where the fun begins as Moody skillfully shares his life experiences.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Mark Christopher Lawrence - Clean Outta Compton
programme.desc: Mark Christopher Lawrence (born May 22, 1964) is an American character actor, stand-up comedian, and voice-over artist. He is perhaps best known for his role as esoteric D.J., Tone Deaf, in the 1994 satirical rap mockumentary, Fear of a Black Hat. He has co-starred in popular films such as Terminator 2: Judgment Day, Planet of the Apes, Lost Treasure and The Pursuit of Happiness. Lawrence can currently be seen in his regular role as Big Mike on the NBC series Chuck. He has made guest appearances on many television programs, most notably Heroes, My Name Is Earl, Crossing Jordan, Dharma & Greg, Malcolm in the Middle, Touched by an Angel, Malcolm & Eddie, Men Behaving Badly, Seinfeld, Murphy Brown, and Martin. He is also featured on the Radio Series Adventures in Odyssey as "Ed Washington".

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Josh Sneed - Live in the Dessert
programme.desc: Hailing from the great city of Cincinnati, Ohio, Josh comes to Dry Bar to bring “new life” to his comedy. Being funny 24/7 can be difficult, but Josh Sneed does it. Watch “Live in the Dessert” by Josh Sneed now!

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Steve Soelberg - Pirate Hymns
programme.desc: Steve Soelberg might actually be a human ray of sunshine. Riffing on his ultra-conservative upbringing, this special balances jokes about the tune of church hymns with hilarious observations of the seemingly mundane.

programme.title: Brian Moote - Getting Schooled
programme.desc: Brian Moote started performing stand up in 2005 while he was working as a teacher in the Seattle School District. He then went to graduate school to get a masters degree in social work because who doesn't love crippling debt? I mean, this is America. After graduating he moved to LA and now tours the country telling jokes. He has made TV appearances on the USA Network's "Characters Welcome," Nickelodeon's "Nickmom's Nite Out," MTV's "Money from Strangers" and AXS TV's "Gotham Live." You should come out and see him tell jokes... DO IT!!!

programme.title: We Used to Eat Animals the Right Way - Here's What Changed
programme.desc: Dr. Bill Schindler explains why the processes we have in place today in the food industry lead to a less healthy and enriched lifestyle. The way humans eat animals has shifted. Our brains grew significantly once the human race started hunting its food. Diets that consisted of blood, guts, and organs contributed to that growth. These parts of animals are almost completely absent from modern day diets and these provided much more nutrition than just the animal's meat.
